cont.entity_a: Still functional after three years despite frequent drops.
cont.entity_b: Mouse has a nice heft and appears durable.

cont.entity_a: Mouse battery life is about two weeks, while keyboard battery life is typically six months.
cont.entity_b: Battery reminder pops up when low. Mouse battery holds charge well.

cont.entity_a: Compatible with Android 4 tablets and Windows 7 64-bit.

Design.comm: Includes a charging solution for the mouse.

cont.entity_a: Compact design fits small desks, but lacks a number pad.
cont.entity_b: Mouse is big and clumpy with poor movement.
Not as comfortable as other Logitech products, feels cheaper and clunky.

cont.entity_a: Bluetooth adapter supports only keyboard and mouse, lacking audio device support.
cont.entity_b: Software bundled is clunky and not required for all computers.
Installation is easy, almost plug and play.

cont.entity_a: Significant lag from first keypress or mouse movement after waking from sleep.
cont.entity_b: Occasional lag or interference if mouse base is too close to computer and speakers.

cont.entity_a: Not suitable for production use due to minimal key travel and lack of a numerical keypad.
cont.entity_b: Keyboard multimedia buttons aren't fully customizable. Some keyboard keys are unresponsive at times.

cont.entity_a: Lightweight and responsive, suitable for use with a PC connected to a TV.
cont.entity_b: Mouse is heavy due to batteries but ergonomic.
